data.message: Aging is bittersweet.  You have all of this wisdom from living a while, yet no one wants to listen to you. There are a lot of lonely "elderly" people who have been put in some institution and who no one ever visits or listens to!

replies.message: I'm afraid that's true and very sad😢
Eventuelly they will be in the same Boat,, , some day
They should start writing a blog.
Aging is wonderful. The older I get the more friends I have. I try to stay in touch with all my friends and never get tired of what is important in their lives
Prayers are helpful, but they also need people that will get involved; whether it is by visiting or in other ways.

having fam. and friend contact is very important to the elderly, a phone call, birthday and holiday cards, let them know the are important people, show love, make them smile is like a dose of good medicine. love is free, don,t cost you a penny.

My mother passed away in 2012 and for 7 years my children and I took care of her. I moved her in with me and took care of her. I was not going to put my mother in a home and then I would be in jail for someone doing something to her. I am so glad that I was here for her.
Yes...... I made up my mine to do more of this type of activity.....
Shirley Elzy I totally agree with you my husband and I took care of both of my parents. I would never allow them to go into a home!  We have no regrets!!

Sad but true , many are homeless or living in undesirable conditions and if their families dont take care of them they bounce from one bad situation until they just give up..when noone needs them anymore they become what todays society calls a burden ,just to visit much less  just give them a place to exist. To eat stay and lay down when tired..and give up and move into aa nursing home..

I ve known more than a few..ive worked in a nursing home..onw precious little lady about 78 yrs put her prettiest dress on on her birthday and set in her wheelchair by the  front door 3 days in a row waiting for her family to visit and celebrate her birthday...NOONE CAME.....shame on these families..and you will be old and helpless one day...God tells us to care for our elderly..
